page.title: 07FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: {Farming in the Area (contd) The fields near to te river are very large and rectangular. These fields are fairly recent as they have been reclaimed from land which was flooded by the river. The river is now bounded by high banks to prevent flooding. It has been straightened and isconstantly being dredged to help navigation and to prevent flooding. The chief crops of the area are cereals, sugar beet, rape, cauliflowers, broccolli and cabbage. Near Frampton fruit especially blackcurrants, raspberries and plums are grown.
